title: Resveratrol attenuates prenatal X-ray-induced microcephaly and adult depression via SIRT1-mediated senescence suppression and TPH2/5-HT pathway restoration in mice.
abstract: With increasing use of medical imaging (e.g., CT scans) and environmental radiation sources, over 2 % of pregnancies worldwide are inadvertently exposed to low-dose ionizing radiation (IR), raising urgent concerns about fetal neuroprotection. While prenatal IR is implicated in microcephaly and lifelong neuropsychiatric risks, prior studies have not resolved whether sirtuin-mediated pathways, particularly SIRT1/TPH2 signaling, drive these deficits or whether dietary phytochemicals like resveratrol can mitigate them.
journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology
